It is characterized by its unique leaf morphology, featuring a thick, waxy cuticle that aids in water retention in arid environments. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or pale yellow, adapted for pollination by specific insect species. Due to its restricted distribution and ecological niche, Phloeophila markertii is considered a valuable subject for botanical research on adaptation and conservation.
